Ah, so this is the game that broke the minds and hearts of fans all over. That cliff-hanger is certainly one of the more infamous ones. Even now, I cannot believe they left it off with that for over ten years. But Valve are a dedicated group, and are finally coming back to us, the players and the fans. 

As for the game in question here, it's great. The terrain-morphing still looks awesome, the writing here is even better and more heart-felt... I could even argue that non-fans would be able to just jump into this game to see all of its fun moments. 

Once again, Valve was able to effectively iterate on Half-Life 2's previous ideas. I adore the many set-pieces, that INCREDIBLE G-Man cutscene, and the tangible tensions that you're presented with as a player. It's a much more dramatic experience from Episode 1, and it uses all of its cards to the fullest -- all jam-packed into a short 4-hour experience. I mean, damn, that is impressive in itself. 

Yeah, that last-section was tedious, long, and frustrating, but everything around it is still as strong as you can get in terms of the franchise.

And, since this is the last main-line Half-Life review of mine until another sequel comes out, I want to mention how incredible Kevin Bailey was for the Half-Life series. Seriously, he fucking nailed it, from 1-Episode 2. Every track has a place, every sound effect is almost hauntingly memorable. I miss him as the sound designer and composer, but Jesus, Episode 2 was a great way to go out. And his final stride would be Portal, which is another discussion for another time. 

This game totally represents all the strengths of Valve and its previous writers, level designers, and composers. You wanna know why they're one of the best? Here ya go.

Despite loving every moment of playing though this game again the end saddens me because I want more. Oh how badly I want more. I swear the second valve brings the Index to New Zealand ima be saving to purchase that bad boy because boy do I wanna play some Half Life Alyx. Man you forget how amazing these games are after not playing them for a while but I always come back and I always have a fantastic time. Some of the best games to ever be produced. There's really not much more I can say than that if by some unholy chance you haven't played these fantastic games yet please do yourself a favour a buy them!

For me this is the best in the series. From the intensity of the story right out the gate to the increased use of competent NPC's whose company not only helps you in combat but also adds extra flavours to the overall narrative, to the blood pumping set pieces that are among some of the best in the franchise.

Even in 2020 it holds up as a memorable timestamp in gaming and the promise that it offered a future instalment is still today just as palpable.

В общем 9 личинок из 10.

This last episode is severely flawed in two places.  One involving an Ant Lion guardian, the other involving a battle against waves of striders.  Despite top marks for trying to mix things up, both needed to be taken back to formula, and very nearly derail the enjoyment of the whole series.

I am very close to giving this one a thumbs down because they do ruin the whole episode, which is otherwise as good as usual.  You get a pass just this once Valve, but I severely hope if there is ever a Half Life 3 or Episode 3 that they don't assume this was ok and repeat similar mistakes that cause player frustration.
I shot spider and it was fun
Stupid final boss but the rest is good

Synopsis: Gordon Freeman and Alyx Vance move forward to reunite with Eli Vance. Their arrival is essential to secure the Resistance victory against the Combine. Along the way, prepare to traverse deep underground caverns to retrieve the larval extract to reanimate a victim of a vicious attack. Your main objective as Gordon Freeman is to rendezvous with Dr. Kleiner, Dr. Magnusson, and Eli Vance to launch a rocket into the atmosphere.

Controls:
WASD = Locomotion
E = Interact/Grab Object
Right Mouse Button = Launch SMG Grenade/Pull Object with Gravity Gun
Left Mouse Button = Shoot/Throw Object
F = Flashlight
Shift = Sprint

Verdict: Add this game to your library only if you want the continuity of the story established in the previous Half Life titles.

Episode Two is similar to Episode One: Shorter game, more story. Overall I really liked Episode Two, it introduces a few new interesting mechanics as well as a new character, sadly you don't get to know him very well since the game is so short. Storywise, it is also a nice continuation that ends in a big cliffhanger that hasn't been continued/resolved to this day in a third Episode or Half-Life 3, sadly. Since I just finished all the Half-Life games in order, I really wanna travel to the teased (and probably final) location and solve all the mysteries, regarding the G-Man, Combine, and all that. So far, good game, 8/10, and great game series and overall story, 10/10, really looking forward to the entry that will finish the Story!

This game is just the best in the series. It is beatufully designed, in both its universe and its story. I feel it ends too soon but I know it is an episode two. Enven if you have not played the previous ones it would still be great. However having recently played them this becomes the jewel of the crown. totally worth your time.
